PERSONA:
meet harold thompson, a 68-year-old white non-hispanic man living in the metropolitan area of jacksonville, florida, within the south atlantic census division. harold has been a lifelong resident of the united states, born and raised in the south. he is a high school graduate, having completed his education at terry parker high school in jacksonville. 

harold is married to his high school sweetheart, margaret, for over 40 years. they have two adult children, both of whom have moved out of the house. their son, jason, is a marine biologist living in tampa, and their daughter, emily, is a teacher in a nearby school district. harold and margaret have three grandkids, who are the center of their universe.

as a proud born-again christian, harold identifies as a protestant and attends services at his local presbyterian church, albeit infrequently. his wife is more active in church activities, and often encourages harold to join her more regularly. harold's faith plays a significant role in shaping his conservative values and ideology.

after working as a mechanic for over 30 years at a local dealership, harold retired six years ago with a modest pension and social security benefits. his annual household income is around $37,000, placing him in the middle-income tier. the thompsons own a modest single-family home in the suburban neighborhood of arlington, which they purchased in the early 1980s.

harold is an avid user of the internet, using it several times a day to stay informed about current events, browse his favorite websites, and keep in touch with his children and grandchildren through video calls. despite his frequent internet use, harold is not very active in volunteering or participating in local community activities.

as an independent voter, harold leans towards the republican party due to his conservative views on social issues and fiscal policies. he is registered to vote and exercises his right in every election. while harold does not identify as a passionate supporter of any particular candidate, his values align with the republican party's stance on issues like gun rights, tax policies, and national security.

harold's economic concerns center around ensuring that his retirement savings last and that his children and grandchildren have access to good jobs and healthcare. he worries about the rising costs of living and the impact of government policies on his social security benefits. due to his faith and upbringing, harold prioritizes individual responsibility and hard work, which influences his support for policies that promote small business growth and lower taxes.

despite his conservative leanings, harold is open to listening to opposing viewpoints and is not hesitant to engage in discussions about politics with his friends and family. his life experiences, education, and values have shaped his perspectives, making him a unique individual within the republican party.
